alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Richmond; Western Essex; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen, Richmond, southwestern Westmoreland and central Essex Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 515 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Champlain, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Rain 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Possible flooding of low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Tappahannock, Warsaw, Montross, Champlain, Newtown, Newland, Dunnsville, Hague, Sharps, Farnham, Haynesville, Beazley, Threeway, Hustle, Mount Holly, Tidewater, Lyells, Kennard, Mount Landing and Erica. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in Ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Richmond; Western Essex; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland
